predictions.text: A U.S. federal funding law (appropriations act or continuing resolution) will be signed by the President that prevents any lapse in federal appropriations through at least 2026-03-31 (UTC), by 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if Congress passes and the President signs a public law (appropriations/CR) that explicitly funds the federal government with coverage through >=2026-03-31 and there is no lapse in appropriations before that date. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent history: House passed final funding bills days before shutdown; Senate consideration underway (CNBC, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Senate floor schedule and cloture filings on appropriations/CR
OMB/White House Statement of Administration Policy
Congress.gov status: passed both chambers + signed (public law number)
News of any shutdown or funding lapse warnings from OMB
predictions.rationale: With House passage already complete, the base rate for last-minute Senate approval/signature is high when shutdown risk is imminent.

predictions.text: The U.S. Treasury will publicly announce (press release or official statement) a CFIUS mitigation agreement / national security agreement explicitly naming TikTok (or ByteDance) related to the new U.S. entity/joint venture, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if U.S. Treasury (or CFIUS via Treasury) issues a public document explicitly stating a mitigation or national security agreement involving TikTok/ByteDance and the new U.S. structure. Otherwise NO.
evidence: TikTok plans a new U.S. entity/joint venture to address national-security concerns (CNBC, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Treasury/CFIUS press releases and speeches
Court filings referencing a signed CFIUS agreement
TikTok/ByteDance corporate announcements naming U.S. governance/data controls
Congressional letters/hearings referencing finalized mitigation terms
predictions.rationale: A restructured U.S. entity increases the chance of a formal CFIUS mitigation package, but public confirmation is not guaranteed.

predictions.text: Capital One will announce that it has closed (completed) its acquisition of Brex, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if Capital One (press release, 10-K/10-Q, or 8-K) states the Brex acquisition has closed/been consummated on or before 2026-12-31. If the deal is terminated or not closed by then, NO.
evidence: Capital One agreed to buy Brex for $5.15B (Reuters, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Regulatory approval milestones (DOJ/antitrust, banking regulators)
Capital One SEC filings (8-K, 10-Q) on deal progress
Brex communications to customers about ownership change
Any DOJ lawsuit or extended review reports
predictions.rationale: Large bank-fintech acquisitions often clear within ~12 months, but regulatory scrutiny can delay or derail closing.

predictions.text: Waymo will launch a paid robotaxi service open to the general public (not employee-only and not closed beta) in at least one additional U.S. metro area not among {Phoenix metro, San Francisco Bay Area, Los Angeles, Miami}, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if Waymo publicly announces general-public paid service availability in a new U.S. metro area outside the listed set and riders can book trips. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Waymo opened Miami service to the public, indicating expansion cadence (TechCrunch, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Waymo blog posts and local launch announcements
City/state regulatory approvals and AV permit updates
App availability changes (service area expansions)
Partnership announcements with local transit/airports
predictions.rationale: Waymo expansion has accelerated; adding one additional city within a year is plausible given current momentum.

predictions.text: Tesla will expand its driverless robotaxi service (no human safety driver in the vehicle) to at least one additional U.S. city beyond Austin, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if Tesla publicly confirms operations of a driverless robotaxi service (no safety driver) in a second U.S. city, with rides offered to non-employees (paid or free). Otherwise NO.
evidence: Tesla began Austin rides without a human safety driver (TechCrunch, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Tesla official posts/releases and earnings-call statements on robotaxi rollout
Local permitting/regulatory statements in target cities
Independent reporting with corroborated rider evidence
NHTSA/DMV communications related to driverless operations
predictions.rationale: Initial deployment suggests ambition to scale, but regulatory and operational constraints make a second-city rollout uncertain within a year.

predictions.text: The U.S. EPA will publish a formal implementation roadmap/strategy document for phasing down animal testing (including dated interim milestones) aiming toward the stated 2035 endpoint, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if EPA posts an official plan/roadmap document (or Federal Register notice with attached plan) that includes at least one dated interim milestone between 2026 and 2035 for reducing animal testing. Otherwise NO.
evidence: EPA revived plan to end animal testing by 2035 (NYT, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: EPA announcements and TSCA/FIFRA guidance updates
Federal Register notices and docket openings on NAMs/animal test reduction
Budget justifications referencing implementation milestones
Interagency coordination statements (NIH/FDA/ICCVAAM)
predictions.rationale: Reinstated long-horizon plans typically require a publishable roadmap; follow-through depends on administrative bandwidth and litigation risk.

predictions.text: The Bank of Japan will not raise its policy rate at any Monetary Policy Meeting held from 2026-01-23 through 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if all BOJ policy decisions over this period leave the policy rate unchanged versus the 2026-01-23 level; resolved NO if any hike occurs (any size).
evidence: Japan inflation cooled to ~2.1%, increasing uncertainty around BOJ tightening timing (CNBC, 2026-01-23).
monitoring_signals: BOJ meeting statements and press conferences
Japan CPI prints and wage negotiations outcomes
JPY moves and JGB yield pressures
BOJ communication about election/food-price sensitivity
predictions.rationale: Cooling inflation reduces urgency to hike, but policy uncertainty remains elevated; probability of at least one hike by mid-year is moderate.

predictions.text: The European Union will adopt (European Council decision and/or European Parliament vote as required) an additional Ukraine-support package with a stated total value of at least €20 billion (grants/loans/military support combined), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if EU institutions formally adopt and publicly announce a new Ukraine package (distinct from ongoing baseline support) with stated value >=€20B by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Zelenskyy signaled strain in Ukraine support coordination, increasing pressure for visible EU commitments (CNBC, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: European Council conclusions and Commission proposals
European Parliament voting calendar and adopted texts
Announcements on macro-financial assistance (MFA) or defense facility tranches
Member-state summit communiqués on Ukraine funding
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical pressure and coordination strain can catalyze a headline package, but internal EU bargaining can delay size/timing.

predictions.text: A U.S.-listed software company with market capitalization of at least $100 billion (at announcement date) will announce an acquisition of an AI model/training-data company (foundation model developer or data provider) for at least $2.0 billion (USD) in disclosed deal value, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if an eligible acquirer announces a definitive agreement with disclosed value >=$2.0B to acquire a qualifying AI model/data company by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: OpenAI chair suggested an AI bubble with likely correction; valuation resets may catalyze major M&A (CNBC, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Earnings-call commentary on AI acquisition strategy by mega-cap software firms
Deal databases (SEC filings, press releases) showing consideration/EV
Investment bank rumor flow on AI consolidation
Venture down-round headlines creating acquisition targets
predictions.rationale: If valuations compress, strategic buyers may pursue sizable AI/data acquisitions; however, antitrust and scarcity of suitable targets limit probability.

predictions.text: U.S. headline PCE inflation (year-over-year, BEA) will register at or above 3.0% in at least one monthly release, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if any BEA Personal Income and Outlays release through the 2026-06 release shows PCE price index YoY >=3.0% (headline). Otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent history: PCE inflation rose to 2.8% YoY in the latest cited release, moving away from 2% (CNBC, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Monthly CPI/PPI and energy/food price trends
BEA PCE releases and revisions
Shelter and services inflation indicators
Commodity price spikes and tariff-related price pass-through commentary
predictions.rationale: Starting near 2.8% raises the chance of a temporary overshoot to 3.0%, but disinflation forces could cap the peak.
